meaning_str.bing:
n. 音乐会；演奏会
v. 协商；合订(计划)；协同工作
网络. 演唱会；一致；协作

协商；合订(计划)；协同工作

协奏曲；音乐会；演奏会；演唱会；合唱会；现场演出；协调；和谐；一致；合作；协作；协定；协议；[音]和声
协调；协力；合作；调和；协同安排；协同工作

sogou-kaoyan.n: 音乐会; 演奏会[出现0次)]

1.en: Mother's day is approaching, Ariel has bought 5 tickets to singer Fei Yu Qing's concert for her mother and her relatives as a gift.
1.cn: 母亲节将至，林依晨买下5张费玉清演唱会加演场次的门票，送妈妈、外婆、姨妈、姑婆等长辈当礼物。

2.en: glimpse of what might have been a movie charting the tragic singer's rehearsals for his concert comeback on its worldwide debut today.
2.cn: 迈克尔•杰克逊的谢幕演唱会彩排纪录片于今天在全球首映，这对于这位悲剧巨星的歌迷们来说堪称一次心酸的追忆。

3.en: And on top of all that, they want help getting their children into certain schools and getting last-minute concert tickets, he said.
3.cn: 他说，最要命的是，他们还要银行帮忙送他们的孩子上指定的学校以及在最后关头弄到演唱会门票，等等。

0.en: Isabel, you're a concert pianist, but Itzhak Perlman himself gave Nelly her very first violin.
0.cn: 伊莎贝尔，你是音乐会钢琴演奏家，但是伊查克·普罗曼把他的第一把小提琴送给了奈莉。

1.en: All this week, the Early Music Society of Pasadena is doing a joint concert with the San Gabriel Renaissance Choir.
1.cn: 这个礼拜帕萨迪纳市中世纪音乐社团要跟圣盖博市文艺复习合唱团联合举办音乐会。

2.en: All right, picture this: a beautiful outdoor concert. Now, as a human, I appreciate Beethoven. As a fungus, I have a terrific view, growing out of a towering maple tree. And no thank you, expensive concessions. Because as an algae, I'll just snack on this sun light.
2.cn: 没问题，试想一下：一场高雅的户外音乐会，作为人类，我能够欣赏贝多芬的音乐；作为菌类，我能够沿着耸立的枫树生长，以获得最棒的视野；我也无需花钱买高昂的酒水，因为作为藻类，我以光合作用维生。

3.en: But then one day, I went to my first Chinese pop concert and it was Harlem Yu performing in the Taipei Music Centre.
3.cn: 但是有一天，我第一次去了华语流行音乐会，是庾澄庆在台北社交馆。

4.en: Fine. Okay, enjoy your concert. Thanks. Enjoy your funeral.
4.cn: 好，你慢慢听。谢了，你慢慢告别。

5.en: No, now I feel bad. You wanna go to the concert.
5.cn: 不，现在我愧疚了，你想去听那场演唱会的。

6.en: What are you and Dan Humphrey doing? We're going to a concert tonight.
6.cn: 你和丹·汉弗瑞去干什么？我们今晚要去个演唱会。

7.en: Hey, come on, we got the gift, the concert, and the cake. Do we need a cake?
7.cn: 拜托，要有礼物，演唱会，还有蛋糕。我们还需要一个蛋糕？

8.en: I've got two tickets to a concert, but there's three of us. So who do I take?
8.cn: 我有两张演唱会的票，但我们总共有3个人，我该带谁去好呢？

9.en: And besides, we had to dispel any suspicion that you and I might be in concert.
9.cn: 再说，我们得打消关于我俩关系的猜疑。

10.en: Plus, I'm going to a concert tomorrow. So I'd invite you, but, I only have two tickets left.
10.cn: 而且我明天要听演唱会，我也想找你，但我只剩两张票。

11.en: He was a concert pianist, traveled quite a bit. He also held a degree in physics from MIT. Sounds amazing.
11.cn: 他是一个演奏钢琴家，他去过不少地方，同时拥有麻省理工的物理学学位。听起来棒极了。

12.en: I'm just gonna pass on the concert, 'cause I'm just not in a very Hootie place right now. Me neither. Me too.
12.cn: 我想我不去演唱会了，因为我现在不太有心情去“猫头鹰”的地方。我也是。我也是。

13.en: I'm so sorry. I really am. But come on, I was an idiot back then. I rushed the stage at a Wham concert, for crying out loud!
13.cn: 对不起，真的，我那时候很愚蠢，我还在威猛乐队的演唱会上冲上台大叫。

14.en: No, look, hey, it's my birthday, and the important thing is that we all be together. All of us. Together. Not at the concert.
14.cn: 不，听着，那是我的生日，最重要的，是我们大家一起过。全部。一起过。不是去演唱会。

15.en: Yeah that's too bad. I really want to go to his concert Friday night, but it's totally sold out. I know. Why don't you meet him and get tickets? If you get two I'll take you.
15.cn: 那真的很糟糕，我真的很想，去听他星期五的演唱会，但票卖完了，我知道了，你为什么不去跟他要票？如果你可以要到两张，我就带你去。
